description: Eternal Destiny is a first-person shooter originally released on Risc PC (Acorn) machines. You play through a variety of Egyptian, High-Tek Japanese, and Manga-themed levels, discovering power cells and unravelling the story, which basically revolves around a Time Machine and defeating a horde of wacky humans and scary monsters. The gameplay and the scenarios are reminiscent of Doom and Quake, with emphasis on pure action, monsters, and a wide selection of weapons.
title: Eternal Destiny

description:
Ankh: The Tales of Mystery is a 3D point-and-click adventure game set in Cairo, Egypt, 500 BC. The player controls the boy Domi Rhadjif who is tasked by his father to help him out with a number of errands, even though there are a number of terrorists outside his house, anachronistically armed with automatic guns. Eventually, Domi has to rescue a princess, deal with the god Osiris, and get rid of the Lybian terrorists. Despite the Egyptian setting, there are numerous modern elements and items used for comical effect.

The game uses a classic point-and-click interface. The mouse is used to move around and actions (Use, Look, Pick up, Talk, Give, and Open) can be selected at the bottom of the screen. Domi can pick up various items and store them in an inventory, shown in the bottom right of the screen. It is possible to talk to NPCs and select from multiple dialogue options.
title: Ankh: The Tales of Mystery

description:
Marsquake is a sequel to Moonquake and like its predecessor it's a variant of Bomberman. The player takes the role of a leading expert on demolition and salvage who is out on a mission at a research station beneath the surface of Mars. Rockfalls have caused damage to the base and it's up to the player to clear up the blockages so that repairs can begin.

The game consists of 32 levels and the player's objective is to clear all the rockfalls from each of them as well as all hostilities that may roam around. Once this has been done an exit opens up and the player will be able to progress to the next level. The player is equipped with an explosive generating backpack that uses energy cells to charge bombs. To remove rockfall the bomb is simply dropped near it and the player has to get out of its range quickly to avoid getting caught in the explosion. Sometimes the destroyed rocks will reveal extra cells for the backpack. These grant the player larger explosions, more bombs, and other abilities. Those abilities include pushing, pulling, and throwing bombs. More powerful bombs include rebound bombs that create huge explosions and flower bombs that can spread around corners. Some cells are unknown and the player has to pick them up to know what they do. The consequences of these can be both good like extra lives and bad like fuel leaks.

Various enemies wander around the levels. There are security droids that can disarm bombs, spirits that can pass through blockades, and wandering bombs that explode when getting close to the player. There are also floating energy creatures that will kill, set off bombs, and light fuel leaks on contact. They can not be killed with explosions. Instead, the player needs a plasma protection suit utility cell to be able to destroy them. Other level features are harmless. There are indestructible objects like walls and machinery, conveyors that can be used to transport bombs, and drains that can be used to stop the burning trails from fuel leaks. There are also pipe networks that explosions can travel through and thereby cause larger explosions.

In addition to the single-player mode, the game also features a multiplayer mode for two to four players. There are eight multiplayer arenas to pick from. The aim is simply to kill the other players.

sample_screenshots.caption: These are security droids that disarm your bombs

title: Marsquake

description: Moonquake is a Bomberman variant featuring one and two-player modes. The player is an expert in rock blasting and salvage work whose task is to prevent the destruction of the moon by removing all the rocks obstructing its air ventilation systems. This is done by placing bombs to clear out all the rocks. In the base, there are two types of nuclear reactors that the player has to be careful around. Red and blue reactors can take one blast but yellow and green reactors must not be hit all. Too many hits and a large atomic explosion will happen. Around the base, the player will also come across security droids whose control circuits have been disabled. Contact with them is lethal, although they can be taken out with bombs. When starting out the player's backpack can generate one bomb of low power. However, by collecting extra energy cells the player will be able to place multiple bombs with more power and range. There are also energy cells with unknown effects, for example, invincibility for a short time or stopping of time. The objective of the multiplayer mode is simply to kill the second player. It is played locally on the same computer.

sample_screenshots.caption: These energy cells increase the power (range) of the bombs
Here I got invincibility for a short time

title: Moonquake

description:
The legendary Pandora's Box has been opened, causing an entire kingdom to be poisoned by the evil that is unleashed. Once freed, this evil being seeks the souls of men and possesses them. By doing so it brings misery, treachery, and corruption to the kingdom. Only one person, the greatest sorcerer of the lands, can overcome its dark magic and once again trap the evil beast in the box.

Pandora's Box is an isometric arcade adventure and as such it features both puzzle-solving and fighting. The game's world is open-ended and consists of over 200 interconnected screens. The goal is to close Pandora's Box by collecting four emerald seals. Most of the gameplay involves exploring the world in search of various objects that are needed to progress. Some objects can simply be picked up from the ground while others can only be acquired by solving puzzles or trading with NPCs. Some characters also send the player out on errands in exchange for a reward. Often these fetch quests where the player has to bring back certain objects. Puzzles generally involve activating objects at the right location or to combine them with other objects. Clues and quests are given on parchments that the player can find all around the world. The player takes damage when bumping into certain characters. At the start of the game, the player is unarmed and can't defend himself but after doing some puzzles weapons will become available. Weapons are equipped from an inventory (consisting of a maximum of eight objects) and are used with the same action button that is used for puzzles. Since the player is a sorcerer he can also create magical staffs and scrolls by mixing different objects in a cauldron.

sample_screenshots.caption: The guards are blocking the exit

title: Pandora's Box

description:
In the far future, the peaceful moon of Lygon has been invaded by a robotic alien race known as the Vorians. The inhabitants of the moon, the Poloids, have been kidnapped and are being held as hostages. Galactic Dan Quicksmart, an agent of the United Planets Bureau of Investigations is being sent to the moon to rescue the hostages. On his mission, he has to search through ruined cities, cave dwellings, and Vorian installations while watching out for the robot guardians that are programmed to kill anyone that opposes them.

Galactic Dan is an early first-person shooter featuring ray-traced graphics. The game is controlled with the mouse that the player uses to shoot, run, jump and look around. There are 24 maze-like levels and the objective of each of them is to rescue a set number of hostages and find the exit before the time runs out. At the same time, the player has to shoot down or avoid the many enemies that guard the hostages. The mission is failed when the player's energy reaches zero or when time runs out. The player gets a score based on how hostages are rescued, enemies killed and time left. It's possible to save more hostages than are required to finish the level.

sample_screenshots.caption: Later levels have more complex level designs
The arrow point out a hidden door in the wall
An exit opens up when enough hostages have been rescued

title: Galactic Dan

description:
Bug Hunter / Moon Dash is a collection of two games on one disk, both previously unreleased.

In Bug Hunter the player takes control of Hysteron Proteron, a being that was designed by bioengineers to be a strong, intelligent, and loyal super soldier able to take out entire armies. Things didn't go right, however. After a DNA mixup, they instead ended up with a tiny spineless and two-legged creature hardly capable of harming any creature. So rather than having it fighting on the battlefields, it was decided that it should instead be used for insect extermination. The game is a puzzle platformer. Hysteon Proteron has sucker feet that allow it to walk on walls and ceilings but lacks any weapons. Instead, it has to pick up objects that it has to drop onto the insects. If it comes into contact with the insects the player loses one of three lives. Once all insects are dead the player leaves the level and moves on to the next.

Moon Dash takes place in the year 4244 where human colonists have been at war with the alien race known as the Judhs for many years. The player is transporting a PR 64 planet ranger to the capital when numerous alien ships appear above him. The objective of the game is to drive the PR 64 through 16 zones until reaching the city. The game is side-scrolling and the player drives his vehicle on the ground while alien space ships try to crash into him from above. While trying to avoid being hit the player can use his turret to shoot back at the aliens. At the same time, he has to jump over various obstacles on the ground.

sample_screenshots.caption: Passing out in the second level (Bug Hunter)
Starting out on first level (Bug Hunter)
And then drop it on the insect to kill it (Bug Hunter)

title: Bug Hunter / Moon Dash

description: Asylum is a platformer where the player enters the brain of a young man called Sigmund. Sigmund has his share of problems and the player has to resolve his mental instability by exploring the surreal world of his inner mind and shut down malfunctioning brain cells. The game plays like any traditional platformer and involves jumping around and shooting at the abstract enemies that roam around. The player can pick up different guns such as a bazooka, a minigun, and others. The game has three levels (referred to as mental zones): ego, psyche, and id. Ego is the easiest and needs to be completed before id is unlocked. Each level is big and requires exploring. The levels are full of items that the player can collect and get points for. The bottom right-hand corner shows a bonus symbol and when collected the symbol will advance until it gets a star. The player will then be transported to a bonus room. The objective of each level is simply to find all eight brain cells and shut them down.

sample_screenshots.caption: This looks like a powerful weapon
This is a really powerful weapon

title: Asylum

description: EGO: Repton 4 should not be confused with the Repton 4 that was included in Repton Infinity. Gameplay-wise it is quite different from previous releases in the Repton series. Although the focus is still on puzzle-solving the player controls Repton (or Ego as he is called here) from a top-down perspective and the goal of each level is to collect puzzle pieces that have to be assembled into a picture of a famous person, building, painting, etc. The player can only pick up one piece at a time and has to carry it to a frame in the middle of the level where it has to be placed at the right place. It's important to collect the pieces in the right order or else an empty place in the middle might be blocked by surrounding pieces. A piece can only be dropped at the right place and it is not possible to move pieces that have already been placed. The player also has to collect gems that are found all around the levels. The picture can not be completed unless all gems have been collected. Different obstacles exist too. Towers and trees might block the path and there are also holes to fall down into and androids to avoid. There are also transporters and conveyors that are needed to reach certain parts of the levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: This is where we bring the pieces, although here it's already quite clear what picture we will get

title: EGO: Repton 4

description:
The Archimedes version of Repton 3 is a compilation and consists of the original game and all of its expansion packs.

  • Repton 3
  • Around the World in 40 Screens
  • The Life of Repton
  • Repton Thru Time

sample_screenshots.caption: Being chased by an alien (Repton Thru Time)
Starting out in the Arctic (Around the World in 40 Screens)
Being hunted by polar bears (Around the World in 40 Screens)
Repton as a baby (The Life of Repton)

title: Repton 3

description:
Alien Invasion is a fixed screen shoot 'em up based on Space Invaders but with some additions to the gameplay. There are twelve different invaders in the game including one that takes two hits to kill. The invaders have three different kinds of bombs: normal bombs that drop straight down, spinning bombs that drop diagonally, and homing bombs that seek out the player. A notable difference from Space Invaders is that the old shields are gone. Instead, the laser base has a built-in shield that can be activated for protection. The player starts out with two shields and gets new ones at the start of each new wave. The UFOs act as supply ships and will randomly drop power-ups that the player can catch. Power-ups include extra lives and shields, stopping the invaders from moving or dropping bombs, and movable rockets. There's also a power-up that makes the invaders invisible.

The game also comes with editors that allow the player to change sprites and wave formations.
title: Alien Invasion

description:
Bloxed is a Tetris variant that most closely resembles the arcade game Bloxeed. The basic gameplay is the same but it adds various power-ups to the game. These are called power blocks and appear randomly as part of tetrominoes and are activated when a row consisting of one is cleared. There are four different power blocks: four lines, filler, shooter, bomb, and 16-ton weight. Four lines remove up to four incomplete lines from the playfield. Filler replaces the next tetromino with a little alien that the player controls and drops single blocks. It can be used to fill in holes in partially finished lines. The shooter does the opposite and shoots away unwanted blocks. The bomb is used to blow up a section of the playfield. The 16-ton weight removes three columns of blocks when dropped on the playfield.

The game also features a multiplayer mode where two players compete side-by-side on a split-screen. A special feature in the multiplayer mode is that if one player completes more than one line with a piece the lines are passed to the opponent.

sample_screenshots.caption: This tetromino has a power block
Sending over blocks to the opponent

title: Bloxed

description:
SunBurst is a 2D shoot 'em up with an economy and gameplay mechanics similar to the Elite games. It contains four different galaxies to explore where the ship needs to stop an alien race from invading. Next to the fighting money needs to be gained by completing missions or through trading. There are four levels of ship types that can be obtained eventually.

To hyperspace to another galaxy, no equipment is needed. You fly to a special space station (one in each galaxy called JumpStat) and press 'H' to make a hyperspace gate open. Docking is similar; you gain permission by pressing 'D' and if granted you fly into/over the space station.

The missions roll on one after the other so you don't have to be a specific status to trigger most of them. The radar is located to one side of the main screen as well as in the centre of the main screen, a sort of head-up-display. To pick up cargo, you need no extra equipment. Fly over the yellow cylinders to pick them up and sell them at any station.

Some space stations have games to play, either a casino or a phase-to-stun game, these can gain you money but equally use up your money.
title: SunBurst

description: Bambuzle is a puzzle game similar to Log!cal. Each of the 50 levels is a layout of tubes that lead to bearings with four indentations; the goal is to fill each one with a ball of the same colour. Those bearings can be spun to send balls another way and explode when they are full. Each level has to be solved within a time limit and there are some special obstacles to take into consideration, e.g. tubes that only let through balls of a certain colour or paint pots that change the colour of a passing ball. A password is rewarded for each finished level.
title: Bambuzle

description:
RISCWorld Volume 8: Issue 6 was the sixth issue of the eighth volume of UK RISCWorld magazine and the last one before the magazine merged with Foundation RISCUser and became Foundation RISCWorld. It contains:* All the latest PD, shareware and freeware releases from the PD column

  • Ancestor+ (updated release)
  • Backup utilities
  • Firefox browser (latest release)
  • Iyonix software
  • Software covered in the letters column
  • Support software for the magazine's series on installing software into VirtualRPC
  • Two toolbox modules

Most notably it contains the game Starfighter 3000: Next Generation, not available separately. It is a new release of the game for RISC OS, different from the original 1994 Starfighter 3000 that was patched over time. This version of the game is a port of the 1996 3DO version by the software group FlaYmz (formerly Visions of the Impossible), headed by Nathan Atkinson. Originally it was to be included with every Omega PC in 2003, but the deal with Microdigital fell through eventually. Code was sourced from one of the original coders Andrew P. Hutchings but the most problematic task was to deal with the many graphical routines which the 3DO used its hardware for. Documentation on the 3DO was difficult to find so the programming effort was massive, being entirely done by Lee Noar. Other people involved were Paul Thomson, Lee Johnston and Ramuh who were all involved in the bolt on introduction sequence.

It uses a different game engine and has enhanced graphics compared to the original version, turning the game world into 3D instead of 2D. There are more colours and special effects such as transparency halo effects around thrusters. Ground textures are now far more detailed. It is fully 32bit compatible and runs on Iyonix, A9, and on VirtualRPC. This version has higher quality audio and cut-scene sequences of cinematic quality animation to introduce each mission. Other enhancements are the sound of large ships at close proximity, the movement of the water, and the ability to level mountains with sustained firing. It is also possible to now play the game from a first-person cockpit view instead of through third-person. In the original game, ship upgrades were bought at the mothership shop through bonuses and cash-convertible points. This version uses ship upgrades through bonuses directly. Unlike the original version of the game, passwords are not supported and all missions of a level need to be completed in one go.
title: RISCWorld Volume 8: Issue 6

description:
Orion is a side-scrolling shooter similar to Defender. Marauding aliens are attacking the player's home planet and it's his task to defend it and its civilians. This is done by controlling a spacecraft left and right over the planet's surface while blasting away at the various enemy forces that both try to take down the player and abduct the people standing on the ground.

If an alien catches a human and drags it to the top of the screen it will mutate and become a dangerous enemy. Humans that fall from a shot-down enemy can be saved by flying into them and then carried back to the surface. If all civilians die the planet will explode but the action will continue in deep space against a swarm of mutated aliens. In addition to the regular fire the player also has access to a limited supply of smart bombs that kill all aliens on the screen. There's also a hyperspace button which allows the player to quickly travel to another part of the stage but using it too much might lead to death.
title: Orion

description:
Jet Fighter is a variant of Jetpac that is largely the same as the original game but features a larger play area and different types of enemies. The player controls an astronaut that first has to collect all three parts of his rocket and then fully fuel it so that it can take off. The rocket parts are located on various platforms that the astronaut has to use his jetpack to reach. After the rocket has been fully assembled fuel will start falling from the sky and once enough of it has been collected the rocket will automatically ascend.

The game is entirely played with the mouse, using one button to thrust upwards and the other to shoot at the strange beings flying around. Any contact with these will lead to a lost life and the game ends on the third. There is also a time limit for each level. Points and bonuses are earned by shooting the enemies and collecting falling objects, respectively.

sample_screenshots.caption: Falling objects like this one give bonuses

title: Jet Fighter

alternate_titles.title: Mysterious goings on at Maddingly Hall

description:
Maddingly Hall is a text adventure game with graphics. The player takes control of Bertie Hall, a 26-year-old gambler who has run out of funds for his extravagant lifestyle. The game which is set in 1932 Great Britain takes place on the titular country mansion that is owned by Agatha, Bertie's rich aunt. Bertie and Agatha are not on good terms but despite this Bertie visits the mansion in an attempt to persuade Agatha to part with some of her money. The aim of the game is to impress the aunt so that she changes her will. At the mansion also lives a girl called Veronica who Bertie is in love with and winning over her heart is also part of the player's objectives.

The game is a traditional text adventure where the player enters verb-noun commands to have Bertie explore the mansion and interact with objects and characters. Tasks have to be carried out and the aunt must be kept happy at all times. Some tasks such as serving dinner have to be carried out on time (each command entered takes one minute of in-game time).

sample_screenshots.caption: An easy way to fail the game...

title: Maddingly Hall

description: Rockfall is a Boulder Dash variant. It is not related to the Atari ST series with the same name more than being inspired by the same game. Like in the original game the objective is to collect a certain number of gems in each of the game's levels. At the same time, falling boulders have to be avoided since being hit by one leads to a loss of life. There are also some creatures moving around the caves that the player can kill by letting boulders or gems fall on them. Some of them will then be turned into gems. There are also bombs that can be collected and used to kill the creatures. Once enough gems have been collected an exit will open that the player can escape through. This all has to be done before the timer reaches zero.
title: Rockfall

description:
The Legend of the Lost Temple is a platformer that takes place in the rain forest of Peru where an ancient tribe has lived in peace for thousands of years until a group of archaeologists stumbles upon it. The visitors carry a virus that the natives have no immunity to and soon everyone but the young and strong members of the community falls ill. The player takes control of one such young man, Kanu, who sets out to find a temple located deep within a mountain. It is believed that entombed in the temple is an elixir that can save the natives. It is the player's task to find this elixir.

Like in other platformers the game involves moving left and right and jumping between platforms while combating a large number of different creatures (bees, eagles, green men, etc.) that stand in the player's way. To kill the enemies Kanu has an unlimited supply of axes (similar to Wonder Boy and Adventure Island) that can be thrown. Other weapons can be acquired by picking up green or blue shields. The green shield gives a mace while the blue shield gives a bolt of magic. Other collectibles include gems that give bonus points and various potions that give increased abilities such as higher jumps, temporary invulnerability, increases fire rate, freeze monsters and provide extra lives. When starting out Kanu has four lives and a limited amount of life blood. Life blood is drained when contact with enemies is made and when it is all gone a life is lost.
title: The Legend of the Lost Temple

description:
Ballarena is a Breakout variant and as such the player's objective is to clear out all the blocks (which here come in many different shapes) on the screen with the use of a paddle that bounces a ball. What makes it different from other games of its kind is that the paddle is not only moved along the bottom of the screen but in a circle around the blocks located in the middle. There are no borders that stop the ball so it can leave the playing field on any side of the screen. When it has done so four times it is game over for the player. Clearing all blocks from the screen leads to progression to the next stage. Like in Arkanoid it's possible to pick up various power-ups. These include giving bonus points, catching the ball with the paddle, and a laser that can be used to blast blocks. The game also features various monsters that move around the screen and deflect the ball. They can be killed by hitting them with the paddle.

Every fourth stage is a challenge stage where the game turns into a shoot 'em up similar to Gyruss. Monsters appear in the middle of the screen and the player uses his paddle to shoot them down as quickly as possible. The player then earns points based on the number of shots and hits.

The game can be played by one or two players simultaneously.
title: Ballarena

description:
Bubble Fair is a variant of the arcade game Pang. The story involves the characters Inky and Jinky who arrive at a fair as soap bubbles start falling from the sky. The bubbles are the work of the sorcerer ARCphile who wants to control all stalls of the fair. To make him stop, Inky and Jinky challenge him to a duel. The duel involves a game of noughts and crosses where each stall represents a square. In each of the stalls, the player has to catch the ice cream that is hidden within a bubble that blocks access to the stall. For each stall, there are two ice creams to catch and when done that square is won. To win the whole game the player has to win the nought and crosses game four times.

Like in the arcade game, it is a platform game with single-screen levels. Bubbles will bounce around and the player's task is to destroy them with the use of an upwards traveling rope attached balloon that when hitting a bubble splits it into smaller ones or destroys it completely. The game features power-ups that are dropped when a bubble is hit. These can lead to both positive and negative effects including increased or decreased time or score, giving a shield, extra balloons, or inverting the player's movement. In total there are 72 levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Upon hit, bubble splits and drops a powerup

title: Bubble Fair

description:
Bug Hunter in Space is a sequel to the original Bug Hunter game. Once again the player controls the Hysteron Proteron which this time is sent to deal with a fleet of alien space crafts. Each craft consists of a number of levels in which the player has to kill all the aliens before entering a teleport to move to the next one. If the craft is flying it is also necessary to shut down its engines and on the last level of each craft, the player has to trigger the craft's reactor and escape before it blows up.

The game plays largely the same as its predecessor but it features larger scrolling levels. The Hysteron Proteron has no weapons (except for some that can be picked up at certain locations) but can walk on walls and ceilings and pick up certain objects. These objects have to be dropped on the aliens to kill them. Additionally, it's possible to jump and activate devices but only when not carrying an object. The player has three lives and one is lost upon making contact with an alien.

sample_screenshots.caption: Dropping an object on an enemy

title: Bug Hunter in Space

description:
Casino is a collection of four gambling games:

  • Backgammon
  • Blackjack
  • Fruit Machine
  • Roulette

All games are played in windows on the desktop and are launched from their own executables. Running one of the programs also launches an application called Banker which keeps track of the player's money. To make bets money is dragged from the banker window to any of the game windows. All games use the same bank account, so any money earned in one account can be spent in another. The game can be played by up to four players. Generous players can choose to give away money to the other players.

sample_screenshots.caption: From the banker we can also add new players to the game
Blackjack - interestingly the dice have their own application
Fruit Machine - dragging money from the banker to start the game

title: Casino

description:
Minotaur is a maze game played from a first-person perspective. It is based on the Greek myth where King Minos sent a group of young Athenians to be fed by the Minotaur in the Labyrinth of Crete. The player's task is to enter the labyrinth, save as many men as possible and then escape before getting killed. The player has to reach the men before the minotaur or else they will die. The labyrinth is randomly generated at startup and it's possible for the player to enter its size.

While moving around the labyrinth the player will come across various items that can be picked up. Most common are the food cans and the bottles which are necessary to avoid thirst or starvation. There are also compasses and pieces of a map that make it easier to find a way through the labyrinth. To be able to kill the minotaur, the player first has to find a sword and will then kill it automatically upon contact. If not in possession of a sword the player can press the spacebar to quickly run away from the minotaur. It will however cause all collected items to disappear.
title: Minotaur

description: Cartoon Line: Part One is a side view fixed screen action game set in the old West. The back story involves a character called Snow Face who attempts to kill everyone in town, including the player. The game contains four levels each involving a number of trials where Snow Face is trying to murder the player in various ways. For each trial, there is only one action that can save the player's life and it has to be perfectly timed. In each playthrough, the trials happen in random order. The player can walk left and right across the screen and use three actions: jumping, squatting, and starting a predefined action. When starting out the player has four lives and additional ones are given for each new level or when reaching 10,000 points.
title: Cartoon Line: Part One

description:
Ibix the Viking is a flip-screen platform game where the player has to collect all the treasure (crowns, coins, and chests) in each level. As the titular Viking, the player can walk around the levels and jump both upwards and straight forward. Some enemies will be in the way and these can usually be dealt with by throwing daggers. There are also various hazards to watch out for like falling boulders and collapsing bridges. Daggers are limited in supply but more can be collected throughout the levels. There are also other collectibles that are needed to progress such as keys to open doors.

The game contains two sets of levels, one easy and one hard, and each is made up of eight levels. The easy levels can be played in any order while in the hard levels a password is required to skip to later levels. In addition to the sixteen levels included in the game, there is also an editor allowing the player to create new levels as well as new scenery or to modify the existing levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Start of the first hard level
The blue thing enables the elevators

title: Ibix the Viking

description:
Thundermonk is an action-puzzle game where the player controls The Lonesome Monk whose monastery has been overtaken by evil demons. The aim of the game is to move through the labyrinths of the monastery, collect treasures and use golden keys to unlock the Doors of Destiny. On each floor, three goblets need to be collected.

The monk is controlled from a side view which looks similar to a platform game but there is no jumping since the monk can levitate through the air. The monastery is full of strange objects that zap the monk's energy when touched but these can be destroyed by throwing bombs. These bombs can be thrown through walls and at specific places, it is also possible to walk through walls. Energy also decreases automatically with time and when throwing bombs which means the player can't take too long since a life is lost when energy runs out.
title: Thundermonk

description:
Hoverbod is an action-puzzle game where the player controls a yellow spherical droid who has to retrieve some stolen treasure from the bad guy Barriuss Stearneruss. The game is played from a side-view perspective and initially, the player is limited to rolling the sphere left and right. However by picking up a collectable the ability to hover in the air is granted. There are two different hover collectibles that decide how high the sphere can move vertically. Another collectable is the missile which allows the sphere to shoot monsters and blast through blocks. Some missile collectables only make it possible to shoot in one direction and a second one has to be collected to be able to shoot both left and right. The monsters are called Ibbles and Squibbles and will kill the sphere on contact. Other dangers include spikes but these can be reversed by picking up the right collectable. Oxygen is limited and a level has to be completed before it runs out although more can be collected.

The game contains eight levels where the objective is to collect all diamonds. Upon the completion of one, a password is given which allows the player to start on the next one. After all eight levels have been completed the game moves on to a final level called the Castle of Gribb. The objective here is to collect 500 feathers that are needed to build two giant wings used to fly home. In the castle, there is a new enemy type, the Gribbles, who grow and multiply uncontrollably.

sample_screenshots.caption: Picking up a collectable that reverses the spikes
Stay still too long and a bird will appear and take you away

title: Hoverbod

description:
Mr Doo is a variant of the arcade game Mr. Do! which makes some changes to the original design. The player controls a wizard who has to collect cherries and avoid various monsters. Unlike the arcade game, the monsters do not chase the player but move in straight lines and only change direction upon reaching a block. The monsters can be killed by throwing a bouncing magic ball or by making apples fall onto them. The magic balls do not recharge in the version but instead, the player starts out with five of them. Other differences include that the apples can not be pushed and that there are no letter monsters. There are some special tiles that add puzzle-solving elements to the game. There are electric cables which kill the player on contact, bombs which detonate when triggered, and sliders which push the wizard across the screen.

The game can be customized and it is possible to turn off both the special tiles as well as the monsters and apples. There is also an option to play levels in normal, random, or reversed order. In total, the game contains 60 levels and a built-in editor can be used to modify them or to create new ones.

sample_screenshots.caption: A level with both sliders and bombs

title: Mr Doo

description:
Talisman is a puzzle platformer where the player is sent on a mission by a king to retrieve a sacred talisman. It has been shattered into six pieces by the evil baron Zaldremon whose forces are now terrorizing the land. The player, who is a wizard, has to recover all the pieces, reassemble the talisman and rid the land of the evil forces.

The game is similar to the Dizzy series, with more focus on puzzle-solving and exploration than combat. The enemies that appear can not be fought and have to be avoided since any contact with them will lead to energy being lost. When the energy bar becomes empty one of five lives is lost. The puzzle-solving involves picking up items (two can be carried at a time) and combining them or using them at the right location. Items can be combined logically or by using magic. With the right ingredients, it's possible to cast spells that change the wizard into a mouse or a bird. As a mouse, it is possible to get into small places but not to jump while as a bird one can reach high places but not go through doors or use objects.

sample_screenshots.caption: A broken bridge - don't jump into the water

title: Talisman

description:
Chequered Flag is a Formula 1 driving simulation game. The game is played from a first-person perspective and the car is solely controlled with the mouse. Moving the mouse horizontally steers the car while buttons are used for accelerating and braking. The keyboard is used for some actions such as changing gears or restarting the engine.

There are three race types (practice, qualify and race) and two competition types (championship and single race). Four race tracks are available in the game: Hungary, Mexico, Monza, and Silverstone. Ahead of a race, it is possible to enter car setup and specify the angles of the front and rear wings.
title: Chequered Flag

description: Serpents is a fast-paced 2D arcade-style game played in a series of increasingly challenging single-screen mazes. The player controls a serpent, Zippy, who must eat the other serpents that patrol the maze. The enemy serpents must be eaten from behind and as the head is finished off Zippy grows longer. The enemy serpents can nibble segments from Zippy if they attack from the side or behind but if they get him head-on Zippy loses a life and the level resets. Later levels include one-way paths, bonuses e.g. speed-ups and smarter enemy serpents.
title: Serpents

description:
Play It Again Sam 2 for Acorn 32-bit computers includes:

  • ArcPinball
  • Master Break
  • Repton 2
  • Zarch
title: Play It Again Sam 2

description:
With the inauguration of the Thames Water Ring Main came the call for a licensed software program to teach students about its operation and water treatment process. Enter James Pond, codename Robocod, on license from Millennium Interactive. James and his friend Ronnie the Raindrop will swim underneath London together, illustrating the operation of the Ring Main through a series of basic action sequences. Following each individual section, James Pond will join the player in the classroom for a quick, multiple-choice lesson about the topic at hand.

The second game of the pack, Running Water, is a real-world simulation intended for older students.

sample_screenshots.caption: Let's start by finding our friend.
Following each multiple choice session, your total score is displayed.

title: James Pond: Underwater Agent and Running Water

description: Wizard Apprentice is a puzzle platformer focused around solving collecting items such as flowers and mushrooms and pushing elements in the environment. The apprentice must complete several trials and help individuals in need in order to become a full-fledged wizard. In some levels, a second, blob-like creature is controlled.
title: Wizard Apprentice

description: Chess 3D is a chess game developed exclusively for the Acorn Archimedes.
title: Chess 3D

description:
Robots have become sentient and have begun a campaign of extermination across the galaxy. Now calling themselves the Rakonan, it seems like humanity is doomed. The only defense is the Llanerk, a flying saucer driven by a black hole mechanism that makes it more powerful than the Rakonan's forces.

Apocalypse consists of nine planets, before each of which you are briefed on the forces each one has. Your objective is to go around, destroying any moving and non-moving targets along the way. Destroy enough and you can advance to the next planet. Don't destroy enough, and it doesn't matter if you lived, it is game over. Furthermore, the Llanerk has a limited supply of energy, with sources of new energy being mostly limited to highly mobile enemy flying saucers.

Apocalypse is one of the earliest first-person shooters to use mouse aiming.
title: Apocalypse

description: Extra 100 Miles is an add-on for E-Type which adds 100 miles of new tracks to drive on, which are more hazardous and hilly than those in the original game.
title: E-Type: Extra 100 Miles

description: The E-Type Designer is an editor that allows users to create their own tracks for use in E-Type.
title: E-Type Designer

description: The E-Type Compendium combines the original E-Type with the Extra 100 Miles and Designer add-ons.
title: E-Type Compendium

description: Overload is a 2D side-scrolling action game. Set on an alien planet, the goal is to rescue all of the small fuzzy inhabitants from hostile invaders. There are 20+ levels, and each one involves locating all of the fuzzies and bringing them back one at a time to the ship, while avoiding or shooting at enemies and collecting energy pickups.
title: Overload

description: An add-on for Stunt Racer 2000 that adds new tracks to the game.
title: Stunt Racer 2000: Extra Tracks

description:
Aggressor is a platform shooter game. The game is set in spaceships full of aliens, but later you will fight them on the Earth and the Moon. You may play as Heckler, Kosh or in co-operation.

The game is definitely inspired by the movie "Aliens" and they appear in first missions, however you will fight against diffrent types of opponents, such as robots (very alike to Terminators), bikers, soldiers, bats, bees, armadillos and many other. They appear endlessly in 8 missions. Each mission ends after a boss fight. Each player has 6 lives to complete all missions, and the following weapons are at your disposal: scatter gun, scud buster, nuke, anti personal mines, incinerator, grenades. You may find additional equipment such as auto load, medi pak, rear defence cartridge which should help you not to lose your lives too qickly. If your character is flashing, it means that the shield is active and you are immune to alien attacks for a limited time.
title: Aggressor

description:
Air Supremacy is a simulation of a tank and a plane. The action does not take place in any specific area - you fly or drive around the area and fight your opponents. Models of planes and tanks resemble those from World War I and II.

In the initial menu, you may start the game, select Flight Practice or Air Combat Demo or simply quit the game. You may select here the type of control - mouse or keyboard. Once you select Start Game, you may choose from three difficulty levels: Novice, Skilled or Ace. The fourth option - Access Combat Arena - will be available after complition of Level 3 as an "Ace".

The controls are quite simple:

  • left mouse button - move forward
  • right mouse button - shoot
  • middle/scroll button - reverse/stop (only for a tank)
  • move your mouse left or right - turn left or right
  • move your mouse up or down - go up or down (only for a plane)

If you control with a keyboard, you move your tank or the plane with arrows, start the engine with A and shoot with S. At your disposal are map and bars for altitude, fuel and speed. You have 3 lives in order to complete all scenarios.
title: Air Supremacy

description:
Alerion is a vertically scrolling shoot-'em-up game. You fly a plane and shoot your opponents, they shoot back, so watch out for their bullets and avoid any obstacles. Your opponents are some sort of flying things and round artillery.

In initial screen you have a choice of a demo, setup keys and play the game itself. Each can be selected either with mouse or keyboard. Setup Keys option shows the default settings and a representation of the keyboard: you use the mouse to click the keys you want, and if you choose the same key twice the program defaults to the standard. Standard setup is as follows:

  • Z - left
  • X - right
  • ' - forwards
  • / - Backwards
  • Return - Air fire
  • Alt - Ground fire
  • Space - Activate FAC - makes your plane invisible for a limited time

Among flying and shooting enemies you will see some objects with F and H letters. Both are bases, but if you bomb eight F bases you will get one more FAC and the maximum of FACs is 9. H bases are some kind of checkpoints - if you fly over them you will reborn from the last H base, so, do not bomb them.

Bomb range is marked with crosshair. You can only fire one type of missles at a time. In the right down corner you will see amount of lives, Wave letter (which means level) and number of FACs. The Wave letters increase as you fly, but ther are no break points in between.
title: Alerion

description:
Interdictor is a combat flight simulator. But it is also a term for a type of mission performed by modern jet fighters. The mission is to prevent enemy supplies reaching the front line.

When you manage to take off your main goal is to destroy enemy's airfields. Your plane has equipment that will help you to achieve that goals and it is 30mm cannon, air-to-ground rockets, heat seaking air-to-air-missles. Of course, you may count on some air fights too. The enemy may try to recapture the bases by sending trucks, so it is highly advised to destroy brigdes, if there are any and to destroy these trucks. of course. The best for bridges are rockets, trucks and barges you may destroy by cannon or rockets. You need to keep an eye on enemy's planes which will try to shoot you down
title: Interdictor

description:
Aliped is a sideways scrolling puzzle game. A spell was put on your character by your evil stepmother. And now you have to find a potion to cure yourself so that you can marry the fair princess. You must hurry, because she will be marry to the evil prince within five days.

The game takes place in a castle. You go by stairs up and down to find keys that will allow you to open doors to chambers or to next wings of the castle. It is largely a game of logic and there are no enemy encounters. Icons around the game environment are used through point-and-click for interaction.
title: Aliped

description:
All-In Boxing is a boxing game with side view. You may play against the computer or human player - you choose that on the initial screen. After selection the game starts.

You start with training. In the punching bag and jump rope sections you earn energy for the next fight. The higher you fill your energy bar the longer you can resist from opponent's attacks. This bar is in yellow. If your energy level drops too low during the fight, indicated by a thin red line above the yellow energy bar, you are knocked out. But if you move your character left and right you will get him back on his feet. You get a report after each round.

You can move your character forward and backward. There are five types of punches are at your disposal: left jab, right punch, body punch, left hook, uppercut and for defense - guard. Each of them is a combination of two keys depending on which player you are playing - 1 or 2.
title: All-In Boxing

description:
In 2067BC you play as a brave and fearless pterodactyl who flies around and killes bees and dragonfiies, and rescues damsels.

You can move in three directions: left, right and up. How quickly you flap your wings determines how fast you can go up, and the only way to get back down is to let gravity take over. Bees and dragonflies can be killed by throwing stones from a height. Stones are collected from the ground.

The game is divided into 14 levels, each of which is spread out over a large playing area that scrolls to accommodate new scenery. To get to the other part of the level you must find a cave with sign IN above it. Your progress through the game is made by compliting different tasks and by solving puzzles.
title: 2067BC

description:
Arcendium is a compilation of four well-knwon board games: Draughts, Reversi, Backgammon and Quadline.

You may play against human player or agains computer, but it must be underlined that computer plays at the highest skill levels. However, you may adjust it by limiting the thinking time. You may let computer to play itself to gain some knowledge about strategy in each of the games. So, it can be treated as a demonstration.

Other available options refers to sound, voice or silence, pause, back-step moves, save and reload of current position.
title: Arcendium

description:
Arcturus is a game in the vein of Marble Madness. You must guide a gyroscope through 104 worlds and collect diamonds as you go.

But it will is not just plain wandering around. You encounter loads of tasks for you to perform. These tasks are puzzles of sorts which you need to think about before tackling and in quite a few cases there may only be one way to get through. All the diamonds must be collected from the levels to get to the next and much harder level. Surface conditions must be taken into account too, each affecting the way the gyro moves and handles. There is ice, which can reduce or take away your grip altogether, and sand, which has the opposite effect. You may find al around the play area some bonuses, power-ups and even enemies. Every 4 levels you will receive a password which will help you to continue your journey from the point where you left the game.

In the main menu you may select options by use of a keyboard, a mouse or a joystick. In here you may select Start Game - if you do not know the password you will start from the beginning by pressing Return (Enter) key, Define Keys, TOP-Ten - the best 10 scores, Quit Game.

Defined keys are:

  • CTRL+F1 - switch map off
  • CTRL+F2 - map zoom 1
  • CTRL+F3 - map zoom 2
  • CTRL+P - pasue (press fire to resume)
  • ESC - restart level
  • CTRL+ESC - back to main menu

Information displayed in the game screen are a map in the left bottom corner, number or remaining diamonds in the right bottom corner and number of your lives next to it.
title: Arcturus

description:
Alien Attack is a Space Invaders clone. In this version you need to destroy aliens attacking Earth in 10 waves. You have 3 lives through all 10 waves.

Your spaceship may fire again when the shot hits the target or it passes the play area. You may fire two shots at one time. Of course, the aliens will shoot back. Starting from wave "E" aliens will fire heat seeking bullets, so be careful.. They will try to crash one of their spaceships into yours.

Controls are as follows:

  • A - move left
  • S - move right
  • RETURN (Enter) - fire cannon
  • P - pause (RETURN resumes the game)
  • ESC - quits the game
title: Alien Attack

description:
Armatron is an arcade game where you fly around with your space ship and defuse a bomb with limited time and collect gold tokens. Tokens can be exchanged for enhanced weapons or shields.

You need to avoid enemies and shoot switches to turn off force shields. Sometimes a small puzzle can be solved, which is rewarded with extra tokens.

You can move up, down, left or right, using predefined keys. There are some secret passages in order to ease the danger.
title: Armatron

description:
Axis is not an ordinary action arcade game. With a top-down view and an unique work of a camera you have an impression that the world revolves around you. Provided you selected to drive your vehicle, which resambles a tank, by a mouse. The other option is to drive your vehicle, called the Rogue, with a keyboard.

You are placed in an alien base and your goal is to destroy all opponents to get through eight quite enormous levels to the core field generator. You may simply shoot them or place a mine with delayed ignition and for short-distance protection you have up to eight orbitals which circle you and destroy any nearby aliens. From time to time destroyed opponents leave some power-ups to restore your strength, as you have only one life, or to improve your weapons.

Each level has its own "boss" which is a turret with long-distance fire range. The best way to take it down is to sneak as close as possible without detection and then attack. As there is no map or compass you must search for flashing arrows placed on the ground to lead you through all levels.
title: Axis

description:
Play it Again Sam 3 is a compilation of games for the Acorn Archimedes.

  • Letrouve
  • Superior Golf
  • Top Banana
  • Zelanites: The Onslaught
title: Play it Again Sam 3

description:
Aldebaran is an action game set on very colourful Aldebaran star. You fly with your space ship and defend your star from aliens who are syphoning Aldebaran's energy. That causes shrinking of the star.

The important goal is to find professors scattered around the star to help you to find new ways of defending the star. Each professor is skilled differently and you must decide who is the best person to assign to each project, and ferry them about to the appropriate labs. Of course, aliens will send their drones to kidnap professors. You may travel to other stars by using 3D model of the entire solar system. However, you need to anticipate the position of next star in 3D solar system model to get to the correct destination. In other way your destination point will be out of range.

In the menu you may find information about resources, types of defence you may use, how many professors do you have and even you may take a break from your struggle by playing Space Invaders on arcade machine.
title: Aldebaran

description:
Battle Tank is quite simple action game with top-down view in which you drive a tank and shoot at foes' tanks. Apart from that you need to activate automatic defences by firing at them from short distance.

On the initial screen you may select from:
★ P - Play
★ I - Info
★ K - Keys

And after selecting Play you may choose the difficulty level from 1 to 3. To acomplish all your missions you have 4 lives. Sometimes your path will be blocked by wrecks of destroyed tanks - do not worry, just wait. They will disappear after some time.
title: Battle Tank

description:
Blitz is simple, but chellenging arcade game. It is one or two players game. Your character's goal is to shoot all bouncing around balls which splits into smaller balls. You shoot at them with some kind of harpoon. As this weapon needs some time to recharge you cannot shoot again till it leaves the play area or hit a ball.

You must avoid the bouncing balls, otherwise you will lose one of three lives that you have. From time to time shooted down balls drop some useful items that provide you extra points or upgrades, such as a time-limited shield. Each level has a timer, so shoot quickly, but precisely.
title: Blitz

description:
Blowpipe is a horizontally scrolling shooter game where you steer some kind of spaceship and you must get through the waves of attacking or charging at you enemies.

It is a regular scrolling arcade shooter game. Your opponents perform certain maneuvers and shoot at you from time to time, so you have to avoid them. You may collect upgrades, such as shields, that are dropped by destroyed enemies. At the bottom of the screen is an energy bar and information about upgrades and the number of the lives. The score is displayed in upper part of the screen .

On the initial screen you may select a keyboard or joystick, redefine keys, turn music or sound on/off.
title: Blowpipe

description:
The Adventure Collection is a collection of two previously-released text adventures, plus one new adventure for the Acorn Archimedes:

  • Cops
  • Kidnapping: Having just returned home after a three-month round-the-world trip, the player finds their father, a famous scientist, has disappeared. The player must find their kidnapped father and bring him to safety.
  • Plague Planet
title: The Adventure Collection

description:
Cyborg is a 1-player text adventure with arcade elements for the Acorn Archimedes.

The player is dashing to the rescue to save some poor sole in distress, when the next thing they know they have crash-landed on a droid-infested planet, shot down from the laser blast from a Mk IV Cybernetic Android, a Cybernaught. The player's ship has been disabled because its power source, Xylenium Crystals, was destroyed in the crash. The player must explore the planet, find new Xylenium Crystals, repair their, and blast off into space.

During the arcade component, the player controls their robotic suit from a 1st person perspective, and does combat with enemy robots. There are four arcade levels: desert, forest, street, and reactor. The player's score in these arcade components determine how difficult the text adventure segment is between arcade levels, with 3 different difficulties based upon player performance.
title: Cyborg

description:
Rise in Crime: The Saga of a Scoundrel is a text adventure with graphics for the Acorn Archimedes.

In the far future, the vast majority of people are content and there is virtually no crime. Anyone who slips through the early conditioning is usually caught during a misguided attempt at petty theft. The player is one of the abnormal few: unconditioned, discontented, and insubordinate. After a badly executed attempt at shoplifting, the player has been confined to their bedsit by Securi-droids pending an investigation and almost certain application of the psychic lance. The player has decided they have nothing to lose, as a life of crime is the only way to rid themselves of the shackles of this mind-imprisoned society.

The player must work themselves through variety of crimes, stealing progressively larger and more expensive items as they become a master criminal.
title: Rise in Crime: The Saga of a Scoundrel

description:
Cobalt Seed is a 3D shooter where you fly a futuristic plane. The aim of the game is simple. You must fly through five worlds to reach your goal, which is the Cobalt Seed.

Waves of enemy fighters and ground vehicles and instalations will try to stop you from reaching your goal. You must avoid buildings and other obstacles as well. You have only one life thus you need to really watch out on your shiled's energy bar. You can recharge your shield by reaching the vital circle.

You can enhance you firepower by collecting special items. So you can improve your laser gun and strengthen the range of your bombs.
title: Cobalt Seed

description:
It is the year 2064 and the earth is under attack from a race of alien droids. You must pilot the "Blue Thunder", the most advanced craft on Earth.

Blue Thunder is a vertically scrolling shooter released for the Acorn Archimedes family of home computers. You are given an energy meter (which can be replenished by collecting floating 'E' icons) and three lives. Collecting 'L' icons upgrades the default laser weapon. There are floating weapon pods that once collected, will attach themselves to the sides of your ship and can be detached to widen your firing spread. A front shield can be collected from level 3 onwards. Enemies are ground and air-based and follow fixed patterns. There is a boss battle at the end of each of the 5 stages.

sample_screenshots.caption: Fighting ground turrets and airships in formation.

title: Blue Thunder
